p:
We also used a permutation method to test the global null hypothesis that there were no interactions among any of the remaining 5 virus groups (IBV, CoV, MPV, RSV, and PIVA). The distribution of P values tended significantly toward zero, providing strong evidence for the existence of further interactions ( P = 0.0021; Fig. 4 B ). This indication of the likely existence of additional virusâ€“virus interactions, that lie beyond the power permitted by our data, is consistent with the large number of candidate interactions (17 virus pairs in total) that yielded P < 0.05. Only 3 interactions (95% CI = 0 to 8) were expected when applying the permutation test of the global null hypothesis to all 72 tests. See
SI Appendix, Figs. S2 and S3 and
Methods for further details.
